review: Came out with stress hives. Tried certazine,  loratidine, they didn't work. Doctor prescribed this and it got worse! It's 4am and can't wait for GP to open so I can beg for some prednisone. Am in agony. That have spread everywhere. This medication has done nothing

It is nearly one year I am suffering from Urticaria.It is true that MD's don't know what causes it.Allegra (Fexofenadine) it the only medicine that works for me.Again it works differently with other people. However, 180g morning and night is a recommended dose. This is expert dermatologist advised my GPfor me.  E45 itch relief (Urea Lauromacrogols) Also helps for immediate itch relief.

Hi guys, had hives now for just about over a year, it is only caused by heat nothing else, never changed my diet I’m fit and healthy and train 5/6 times a week at the gym, obviously the hives outbreaks are horrendous as it covers my whole body except my face. I been taking fexofenadine 180mg for almost 6 months and no use at all if anything it makes it less itchy but the rash is worse , I’m going to start taking two in the morning from now and see what happens..

Effective for my dermatitis or ezcema and hives. It does take away the sneezy, watery nose and itchy eyes. I have been taking it for two weeks daily. Currently, my allergies are so terribly bad that I itch everywhere, even in my groin; it is embarassing. So I am stuck with this 180mg med. I used to have UV light therapy which  helped greatly. Now I live away from my dermatologist. I don't know what is worse, the anxiety side effects or my constant itching and redness on my skin, which sometimes turns brown when scratched. Pinetarsol soaks in a bath-tub helps temporarily. Any heat and sweatiness brings the urticaria back. Some pred cream prescribed doesn't really solve the problem. I really wonder what is the cause and the immunologist, dermatologist and GP can't tell me. Just saying that its pollens, creams, food and a host of other stuff causing it plus stress. I wonder whether I can take the COVID vaccine with such a problem. It's been 10 years of suffering.

So I used to use Over the Counter antihistamines but recently they’ve become ineffective. The Doctors prescribed me with fexofenadine and it did not do anything at all. I’m struggling really hard because I’m bed ridden most of the day because all the sneezing is causing pains in my body from all the strain. I’ve gone back to trialing over the counter medication.

I was prescribed fexofenadine 180mg daily for severe itching due to eczema but I also suffer from hay fever too. Initially worked great for the itching (I was talking it every other day at this point), however when hay fever season started I upped this to one tablet per day and began to experience horrible symptoms.I had heart palpitations, anxiety and had panic attacks for weeks before I realised that it might be caused by these tablets. I also have a heart condition (mitral regurgitation) and thought this was getting worse as the palpitations were horrible so was very concerned.After stopping the medication I felt better within a few days although the anxiety did linger for a week or so. Very scary experience!!!

I'd suffering from urticaria last one year.  I took all meds, but nothing was working.  At last my doctor prescribed me fexofenadine and loratidineIt is really magic. My hives go away 70% now I can eat all food thanks fexofenadine

Allegra (fexofenadine):This is really a question than a comment. The question is for "Trac" who was going to post the results of his treatment, it was a while ago May 5, 2018. I am interested to know how and if it was treated. Thanks!

Went to pharmacist this morning after suffering continuous sneezing , itchy eyes and nose running like a tap. He gave me fexofenadine 180 and said it would work. I have now taken the correct dose of tablets since this morning and absolutely no improvement . I'm desperate. Tried other anthistamines before this and they don't work either.
It doesnt help.

Allegra (fexofenadine):I have chronic idiopathic urticaria, may have autoimmune component. It started 4 months ago after multiple days off bites by oak mites and maybe a spider or two.  I'm on 3 x 180 mg Allegra and 300 mg zantac in the morning plus 3 x 10 mg Zyrtec and 300 mg zantac at night.  Plus miscellaneous Benadryl here and there.  Hives went away for few weeks and now they are back.  Can't afford Xolair.  Not sure what's next.  This is craziness. Might have to research "Vitamin D deficiency in chronic idiopathic urticaria"
Allegra (fexofenadine):Good for urticaria

Allegra (fexofenadine):My sister in law whom is a M.D, recommended me Allegra daily for my urticaria. I was hesitant at first for the fact that I didn't want to begin my day taking pills. I guess I was waiting for my hives to clear on their own which till this day I still struggle. Allegra,   is my savior I take 1 every morning to relieve my itchiness and welts, they help me very much.

Allegra (fexofenadine):I have eczema which cause awful flare ups on my hands and caused my skin to get dark . All the topical steroids I applied did not help heal the skin neither did it change the color. However with one allegra a day my skin instantly looked and felt better. Also, it always cures any respiratory allergies as well. I truly recommend this medicine.

Allegra (fexofenadine):I started getting daily urticaria in October 2018. At first, I just hoped it would go away, and I refused to take antihistamines, but after a month of itching and rashes, I started taking Allegra. The Allegra worked well; my rashes and itching were significantly reduced. However, Allegra is only effective for me at daily doses of 180 mg or higher. I tried the 60 mg doses; they helped but there was still itching and random rashes. With my doctor's approval, I eventually doubled the dose of Allegra to 360 mg daily. This dose is very effective for me. For me, side effects are non existent with Allegra. I have tried other antihistamines, but Allegra and Loratadine are the only ones that aren't noticeably sedating. Cetirizine is supposed to be non-sedating, but that isn't the case. If anyones has chronic urticaria, I recommend first trying the 180 mg dose of Allegra. If this isn't enough, talk to your doctor to see if it is okay to take the 180 mg dose twice daily.

Suffered for 15 yrs went to many drs. Went to immunologist put me on 2 allegra morning and nite. Said reg dose will not suppress them. mazing results. Also took xolair shot, extremely expensive but insurance did pay.

Been suffering from chronic idiopathic spontanous uritacaria for 3 months now. Drs prescribed this after I had taken week prednisolone and ranitidine (zantac). I started on 120mg which didn't work then drs increased my dosage to 180mg twice a day that did not work. I've just not bothered taking it unless necessary now and I think benadryl gives me slight comfort. Fexofenadrine is absolutely useless for me. This was the same medication I was given last summer due to hayfever and it did not work at all. Terrible

Fexofenadine was first prescribed to me for chronic urticaria with angiodema five years ago by a private Dr in the UK. Symptoms disappeared for five years but came back this summer. Have since moved to France and was worried I wouldn’t be able to find this drug but thankfully I’m back on it to control the misery that is living with hives/angiodema. More than that - it’s actually a wonder drug for me.....honestly couldn’t live without it!

Allegra (fexofenadine):Been battling Uticaria for 5 years and taking Certizine, Hydroxyzine and Zantac. Constant itching. Don't know why.  Never completely goes away unless I take prednisone which I normally don't use, but I will take for about a week to get some relief from the constant itching. I try, not very successfully, to not to scratch the itchy hives which I hate  with a passion. Because of the favorable remarks about Allegra I'm going to use this medication.  I've also been treated with Light therapy which has worked quite well in temporarily clearing up my skin.

Allegra (fexofenadine):Guys, it works great for a temporary relief of the hives for sure.  Don’t ever settle for idiopathic if you get them often though.  I have been going through this for years myself, constant break outs, suppressing symptoms, now I’m done doing that.  I’m getting to the root of the problem, and the answer is going to integrative functional medicine.  This issue seems to be more gut related and it’s gonna cost me a fortune, but they have the proper tests to run to find out what’s going on instead of pushing a million pills on you.  Let me tell you, my issue and probably a lot of you have auto immune related things going on.  Don’t ever let someone tell you that auto immune means your body is attacking itself, I can promise you it’s not.  It’s your body trying to heal itself, that’s what our bodies are made to do in crisis.  I will update once I get my tests done.
fexofenadine is a great medicine, but if you are on statins  that may be the root cause, fexofenadine does help enormously with symptoms.

Allegra (fexofenadine):It's a great medicine for the hives I get Daily, other medicine were good but non drowsy allegra is the best solution. Now my worry is how can I get rid of the hives permanently coz if I don't take a pill a day then the hives start appearing back immediately. Any solutions?. My life is now dependent on this medicine. Can anyone please tell me the side effects of this medicine coz am taking it on daily basis.

Allegra (fexofenadine):I am 47 years old and I have been suffering from urticaria since 2014. After lots of treatment now I am taking allegra 180mg twice a day...but only when I take allegra my itching reduces (does not completely vanish) but when I didn't take it again erupts. Is there no permanent treatment to it? How long one can take medicine..

Allegra (fexofenadine):From past 1 yr I'm having chronic urticaria. If my diet is clean no hives occurs, it's due to food that  I eat. After months of steroids and h1 & H2 antihistamines I have recovered almost 70% now from past 3 days I didn't took any medicine, as I ate some oily food n chicken outside my hives have increased so now I'm taking Allegra 120 mg (half)tablet after reading all the above comments.Next review will be soon
works well for my itchy skin and rhinitis. I take it daily and will continue.

Allegra (fexofenadine):I have suffered from severe urticaria for years, claritin and zyrtec never did anything for me. I tried oatmeal creams and baths , benadryl and any kind of anti-itch cream I could find, nothing works like Allegra and Pepcid, as long as I take it daily I'm hive free. ALLEGRA is the answer to Hive sufferers.

This medication has teduced the hives and swellings I get when touching cold items like keys, refrigerated vegetables and frozen foods. It has also reduced  my skin's reaction to touch and pressure. I have noticed though that my skin on my face is getting 'rougher' and not as soft as it was before I started taking the medication 4 month's ago.

I am suffering by a strong urticaria, i tooked  fexofenadine 180 mg i felt very good and the urticaria has 90% gone but after 1 week it returns idk why and i was still taking my pill so i started taking 1 pill morning and one at night and the urticaria is still here but all i'll never give up maybe i am going to use hydroxyzine now

I have severe chronic ulticaria angieodema. My gp prescribed me 180mg a day which helped but not resolve the problem. He then had me try piriton which made me sick and dizzy. He referred me to an immunologist who has now prescribed me 720mg a day fexofenedine. Its been a week i feel like a new person.. only downside is convincing my go that my immunologist knows what he is doing updosing x 4!! Ppl get yourself referred to an immunologist and get yourselves sorted out ☺ note i am in the uk and my immunologist was done via private health cover and my drugs are via the nhs.

Allegra (fexofenadine):I have suffered from cold hives for about 10 years now and till this day I have not found a solution. Allegra does nothing for me. I take about two allegras everytime I step out my house and still get hives all over my face and body. Thats more than the recommended dosage for 180mg. I still have hope that theres a cure somewhere out there
Take with care if you suffer from focal migraines - instantly brought on an attack for me. Stopped the meds straight away, no idea whether it would help for my Urticaria
This fexofenadine really works for my urticaria. I got a strong and painful urticaria god knows from where. After a week  this product is helping a lot . Not side effects whatsoever.

Allegra (fexofenadine):I have chronic idiopathic urticaria and like a lot of other people on this thread I tried Benadryl,creams, oatmeal baths, changing soaps... didn't help. I tried Allegra for the first time last night and had almost instant relief. I still have some hives but the itching is far less intense and the hive are less red. I am glad I came across some of these reviews!!

Allegra (fexofenadine):I went to a local clinic to treat Urticaria and was given 60mg of prednisone on my cheek. It had no effect on my body and the symptoms even got worse.Then my doctor recommended to take Benadryl (H1 blocker) and Zantac (H2 blocker) altogether. I took both pills and it made me extremely drowsy (Benadryl) and Zantac actually alleviated my symptoms just a little bit.I woke up next morning and found out that Urticaria has come back.Then someone recommended me to take the Allegra (Fexofenadine 180mg) and it really works without any side-effects of drowsiness.I think Fexofenadine is god given allergy medicine. I tried Benadryl, Zyrtec and Claritin before. Their effectiveness on Urticaria is far less than Allegra.
Aller-Ease (fexofenadine):Used it for two months and had no results it was still really bad!

Allegra (fexofenadine):I recently had an allergic outbreak of hives ...My doctor prescribed prednisone 6-day pack and steroid cream.I tried benadryl first thinking it would help control the itching.  It did not.I was so miserable from the itching the hives caused I was willing to try anything.I came across this page about Allegra.   I was prescribed Allegra in the past and it worked really well for my seasonal allergies.  I decided to give Allegra a try ...  I'm glad i did!!!  It Stopped on the itching and cleared up 80% of my hives in 1 hour...  Thank God this is Over the Counter.Doctors always tell you to use Benadryl ... it will only make you sleepy and its not very effective at controlling the itch of hives.   Unless you take a very large dose.

Allegra (fexofenadine):I suffered from chronic itch all my life tried almost every other antihistimine to the point I had to start with prednisone every 3 months for a week to get rid of the itch over my whole body eyes running nose I would have such severe itch that I just could not function normaly got 4 hours or less sleep a day. I now use this medicine for 2 days now, after one hour I took the medicine I felt my eyes not itching and my skin feels much better to the point its liveable.  Now I hope this will keep working even after some time because all previous medication would only work a few days a week tops so if this will continue to work I can finaly start my life. I'm 22 years old and I finaly have new hope now thank you fexofenadine!

Allegra (fexofenadine):Had chronic urticaria 3 years ago, tried everything from Benadryl, Zyrtec, Claritin and nothing worked. Took a Allegra 24 hour and 70% of my hives have disappeared leaving me less itchy. Wish I would've found out about this site earlier to do my research. This is my first day on the medication, hopefully it will go away after this week.

Allegra (fexofenadine):I have been suffering from hives on my face (very embarrassing) from food allergies for the last few years. Since I gave birth to my first child it became worse. Finally an allergist suggested I take 60mg of Allegra everyday and for the last week I have been almost 100% hives free. My face is so clear and white again! I feel amazing and confident again thanks to Allegra.
Allegra (fexofenadine):Best relief for hives. Prefer this over Xyzal.

Allegra (fexofenadine):I was taking Zyrtec, Benadryl, Benadryl gel and Pepcid for hives. Nothing got them under control until I tried Allegra. I am amazed my doctor did not suggest I try it. I had a week of steroids which worked but the hives came back once I finished them and the doctor would not give me more (not that I want more) I was miserable--now it's tolerable. Still have no idea what caused the hives. I am 53 and have never had a hives outbreak like this.

I get severe swelling (angioedema) from bee stings. The last sting was on my right hand which swelled up so bad I couldn't bend the fingers or use the hand at all. The forearm also swelled up. The doctor gave me fexofenadine and a strong antihistamine cream. Within two days the swelling was almost gone, and by the third day everything was back to normal, whereas usually it takes a week. Also, while taking the medicine I hardly had any itching from the venom. As I was using a cream in combination with the medicine I can't say it was all due to the fexofenadine but for sure it helped a lot. In addition, I had no side effects at all, which is unusual as usually I develop at least one or two when taking medicines. I will use this again if needed.

Allegra (fexofenadine):I have had chronic hives for the past 8 months and originally took Zyrtec which worked OK for a while but then stopped working.  I switched to Allegra which I have been taking for about 3-4 months now and it has been working.

Allegra (fexofenadine):I finally found a medication that controls my hives. Ever since I was a kid I have ben battling hives that come and go every couple of years. Its the type where my face swells and hives all over. I've been through prednisone treatments and several other medicines that make me drowsy. Nothing works like Allegra. Definitely worth the price.
Allegra (fexofenadine):Only medication that helps control my hives, urticaria and angioedema.

Allegra (fexofenadine):My husband got a very acute urtricaria on his whole body for 2 weeks. Nothing helped really to get rid of the burning patches. Benadryl caused more drowsiness then any help and additionally my husbands face was sweeling all over when taking Benadryl. Finally we got Allegra 180 mg pills. And just after the first Allegra pill all red patches on his skin and all swollen areas were gone for good as long as he keeps taking it twice a day 180 mg each tablet. This medicine is really great.

Allegra (fexofenadine):I have urticaria for more then 6 years. Finally I got this pill Allegra 180mg, finally works. I took about a week and my hives are really gone, and now I'm finally happy and I don't feel any side effects at all.
Allegra (fexofenadine):It's the best medicine for hives. I took 1 and it's all gone.
Allegra (fexofenadine):All I can say is that Allegra is worth it..It may be expensive but it can cure skin allergy fast..fantastic!
